title: [Large-Scale] Mobile Microlearning Courses for Expanding Work-Integrated Learning (WIL)

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Understanding of Career Exploration and Social Advancement
context.additional_context: Students learn WIL theory and practical case applications in mobile environments, conducting small-scale projects linked to community partnerships

learning_goals: Learners can explain the core concepts and educational effects of WIL

Learners will design a Work-Integrated Learning (WIL)-based problem-solving project in three stages (problem definition-solution design-execution planning) using mobile platforms (Notion, Google Workspace, etc.) and submit one prototype or execution report per team.

Learners will analyze WIL project scenarios by collaborating with three local community organizations (e.g., regional welfare centers, social enterprises) and propose practical collaboration models through a five-stage simulation activity (problem definition, collaboration planning, execution plan drafting, role-playing, outcome evaluation).
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
